div.p: Conversion of Skills. The actual formula is level = log10(19 * skill/100/(1 - skill/100)) in the range 5 - 95. Beyond 95, the formula is 3.5 log10(x - 94) + 25.4. Below the regression is 1:1. as shown in the table.
Conversion of Attributes. The actual formula is level = 2 * (attribute - 10.5).

Where multiple scalable dimensions are given, a certain skill level only applies to one, i.e. of multiple dimensions shall be increased, multiple skill levels must be available. Specialties apply as per "original" rules, in particular at higher levels, for each skill. The source for the skill names is Harnmaster 3.

Learning is modelled by succeeding an active roll with level against a passive level of the current skill. Note that rolling 10 non-stop events can be shortened into rolling a with a . Learning is not applicable to attributes.

Such rolls may be made once a month in which the skill was used reasonably often. Usually only three such rolls apply. A combined roll with the SB is made, with a bonus for equal skill of (see the main page on Combination). A teacher can also be combined with his own skill - and a bonus (row index) of . This assumes that the teacher is available almost always during that time.

For career development, take the sum of the number of all SBs (e.g. SB/2 and SB/3 would be 5) for a career. Now take the duration of learning for that career in months (e.g. 4 years) and multiply by (e.g. 144), which is the number of rolls. This number should be distributed among the skills according to the multiplicity among the skills (e.g. 2/5 for 58 and 3/5 for 86). Any base addtion, such as scripts, count as SB for every points, including any fractions thereof.

His SB is (-1 -1 -1)/3 + 3/2 = 1, rounded up in favor of the PC. This time a teacher will provide a bonus of . Adding this together with the (starting) skill level of , this yields a . We extend the table above to get to a skill level of 18 with 57 rolls. As always, the remaining rolls can be used individually, can be redistributed with other skills, or forfeited.

Optional skills: Any number of years can be used to improve other skills in the manner above. A teacher of skill level can be assumed, unless a guilded profession is required for the skill and the PC is not member of that guild. Then probably no teacher is available, which can mean that a learning penalty of may be applied, if reality cannot be assumed as "teacher". A teacher applies to veteran points and militia duty, which are treated in the same way as regular acquisition of optional skills..

ul.li: Level 0: NN barely knows that a domain for such knowledge exists. With some luck, he can guess whether a general topic belongs to that domain or not.
Level 5: A single topic, one of the most obvious ones has been heard of and can be applied, but without guaranteed success.
Level 10: With this level, the basic concepts are known, the more esoteric concepts have been heard of but cannot be applied.
Level 15: Most concepts are known and many can be applied with a high degree of certainty. There are still areas which can be polished.
Level 20: All concepts of the domain are known and can be applied with confidence. There are only a few topics escaping the grasps of this expert.
Level 25: All of the domain is understood with ease. It is hard to find unknown territory, although it exists. Improvement of the art can be conducted.
Level 30: Mastery of the subject matter as far as humanly possible. Genuine research or creation of new substance is possible.

Piety: Serves as skill for specific magic/religious rituals.
Level 0: NN knows that the reigion exist but cannot separate it from other convocations.
Level 5: Lip service payed to the religion and ability to separate it from other major faiths.
Level 10: The main tenants of the religion are known and followed on individual level. Sects or heresies are not considered.
Level 15: The religion is quoted often and other faiths routinely treated underhanded. Proselytizing is rarely attempted.
Level 20: At this level the adherent is actively seeking to further the tenants of the religion outside of his immediate domain. Distinction between inner-religion minutiae are important.
Level 25: Heresy is abhorred more than other religions. Support for the religion takes precendents over other interests almost always.
Level 30: The adherent is a prophet for the religion and accepts otherwise serious consequences for following details of his faith. May invent rituals and the like.

div.p: Initiative determines how long it takes to bring a combat skill to bear. I.e. how long does it take before a combat skill roll can be made. A premature roll can be made, by taking a penalty that matches the premature time. Note that the time interval is used looking for openings, keeping ones own balance, etc. and must be actively chosen. A point in time cannot be chosen, let alone decided upon on the spur of a moment. Dodge as skill is opposed to Initiative and is deducted. The skill may be and Agility may be added through row .
Aborted actions will be resolved as if intended that way. For playability reasons partial effects will not be applied until the action is completed.
In order to avoid being injured in combat, a defendant can improve his passive resistance by using his Agility and the combat skill he uses to attack.

Subtract the active and passive combat skill from each other. Consider all modifiers that apply in the classic rules here. The A/D numbers are used as additional modifiers (divided by five). Using a weapon or a combination in the wrong hand implies a penalty of-. The weapon and armour B/E/P values are each subtracted from each other individually, and the results are all added to the injury dimension. Wounds are treated individually for recovery (see below).
Injury is applied directly as bonus to the passive side of any skill or attribute roll.

An additional roll is made, any time a strike is delivered regardless of whether noticable injury was caused. Subtract active from passive quality. Don't forget to roll a second time with rolls reversed. If both weapons and/or multiple pieces of armor are concerned, you can use the composition/decomposition rule.
Damage applies to the appropriate B/E/P value directly until is reached. Quality rating is also affected through row on the passive side.

All impediments affect all types of activity. All are modified by Stamina(live)/Quality(dead). Recovery is only possible during rest. Dead objects do not recover but are repaired. Edge/Point may infect. Chance per day is penalty being healed as percentage.
Impediments below add HR penalty as max component. HR as percentage is rolled once per unit time for +1 % or -1 % in HR. For diesase and infection this unit is one day.
Applies to all types of wounds (BEP).
